W: Q3 It usually takes about four days. The business office can call you as soon as the loan has been approved.

M: Hi, Angela. I just got an e-mail from UHP incorporated. Q1 They are asking about installing the plumbing systems in their new offices. They want to know when we will begin.
W: Q2 I intended to call them today, but I’m waiting for a call from some workers. They are at the building site now testing the ground. Q3 It seems as though there may be some problems installing the pipes underground. We may need to dig deeper than we expected. I will let them know by this afternoon.
M: I see. I’ll call UHP and let them know the situation. They didn’t sound like they were angry, they were just curious to know what was going on. Let me know when you hear back from the workers.

W: Okay, I’ll wait.
M2: Hi, Mrs. Kraft. They are having some renovations done at the Swiss Tower Building so we need to change your move-in date to the end of October. Will that be okay with you?
W: Well... not really. I will have nowhere to live, and it’s far too expensive to stay in a hotel.
M2: OK. We will be happy to pay for your hotel expenses until you can move into the apartment. I’m really sorry for the inconvenience. We only found out about this today.
W: That sounds fine.

answer.explanation: (W-Br): Thank you for the opportunity to speak at this month's meeting of the Penndale Civic Association. Q1 On behalf of my company, Marino Builders, I'm happy to announce that we've broken ground on a new 10-story building in the city center. It will be known as Highpoint Tower, and construction will be complete before the end of next year. Q2 We know that the civic association has dedicated itself to revitalizing Penndale's business district, and we believe our project will help to attract new businesses and customers to the area. To show how it will do that, Q3 I'd like to present a short video that will take you on a virtual tour of some of the building's most notable features.

question.text: What is the subject of the announcement?

What will the speaker most likely do next?

MIDNIGHT CRUISE ITINERARY
5:00 P.M Captain's address
6:00 P.M Cocktails and dinner
7:00 P.M Constellation orientation
8:00 P.M- 10:00 P.M Social Mixer
10:00 P.M Port Lewis for champagne toast
11:00 P.M Cast off and back to Billing's Bay
12:00 P.M Midnight constellation lesson and meteor shower on Top Deck

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
Welcome aboard the Midnight Cruise, Loveport’s most romantic evening! We will be spending the majority of our cruise in Billing’s Bay, but we will also be following the coastline of Eagle Island to Port Lewis for a champagne toast. During our cruise, our host, Star master Jenkins, will be directing you through the constellations that are in view, and with any luck we will be able to witness tonight’s meteor shower! While we are cruising, we ask that you wear your life jackets at all times when on deck for your safety. If you begin to feel sea sick at any time, I encourage you to visit our on-board clinic for some medication. Now I would like to ask everybody to join the captain in the stateroom for a rundown of this evening’s services!

question.text: Where will the cruise spend most of its time?
Who is Star master Jenkins?
Look at the graphic. How long will the cruise be stopped at Port Lewis?

answer.explanation: Hello everyone. Q1 I wanted to get you together to go over the recent failures in our customer service department here at Monster Telecom. As you know, customer service Is at the heart of everything we do. We receive on average 3,000 calls per week from customers with a wide range of needs. Q2 In order to prepare you all to handle the most frequently asked questions from our customers, I have distributed the graph in front of you. Please go over this graph with your team leader and develop a plan to improve our customer service. Next quarter’s reviews will be in two months. Q3 We aim to have half as many weekly calls by then.

answer.explanation: W-Br: Good morning. The main focus of today’s meeting is our bus company’s quaterly earnings. Overall, we’re doing well, but Q1 there has been a noticable drop in ticket sales on routes to Cooper City. Cooper City was once a major tourist destination, but since several museums closed in the historic district, fewer passengers choose to go there. This’ll now be the third quarter in a row of a stready decline in ticket purchases, so Q2 I think it best to reduce the number of bus trips to that location to just one a day. Q3 I’ve created an updated schedule that reflects this change. Please look it over, and let me know what you think.

answer.explanation: If you’re looking for reasonable prices on ink toner, then stop by Quill Office Supplies in Rochester! We have replacement ink toner to fit all models of printers and copy machines. During the month of April, we will send a technician to your location at no charge to help you remove an old ink cartridge and install a new one. If you sign up for regular cartridge refills, you can receive a 5% discount on all of your purchases. For more information, please visit our website at WWW.quill officesupplies.com.

question.text: What business is being advertised?
What service is available in April?
How can listeners get a discount?
choices: (D) By signing up for a newsletter

question.text: By striving to be neat, well dressed, and cheerful, our representatives can make a good first ___ on our clients.

answer.explanation:
First impression = The influence sb first has
The answer goes with "a" and "first" so we use a noun.

question.text: _____ making structural changes to a house must first apply for a building permit.

answer.explanation:
We need a subject => anyone is correct
=> Choose D

question.text: The plane will be landing ___ Chicago in twenty minutes.

answer.explanation: (C) In is used with city locations. Choices (A) and (D) are not used with locations in this context. Choice (B) may be used only when a from/to contrast is stated or implied (e.g. from the suburbs into the city).

question.text: Some of the leather used in this handbag must  _____  from Italy.

answer.explanation:
Passive form of must: must be + past participle
=> Choose B

question.text: Insurance specialists at Datweiler & Associates receive three months of intensive training ___ they begin working with clients.

answer.explanation: We connect a clause with a clause that will happen later by the preposition "before".

question.text: As Mr. Nakata’s assistant, Ms. Bain is in charge of_____him on the latest financial news.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning to choose the right answer.

question.text: The successful candidate will be contacted by an HR representative once the hiring committee makes its ______ decision.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer
=> C

question.text: The non-profit organization released to the press several documents  _____  the largest donors and how much they contributed.

answer.explanation:
This argument reduces active clause statements.
"Detailing" = "which detail".

question.text: While some countries have made huge investments in the Caribbean lately, others have reduced --------.

answer.explanation: their (other countries') investment = theirs

question.text: In addition to fine dining, the elegant Ipswich Inn provides every amenity ___ for small or large business meetings.

answer.explanation: "Necessary" is a shortened version for the relative clause "which is necessary".

question.text: He___about that issue for last month’s report.

answer.explanation: (B) This is a simple past tense verb that describes an action that happened last month. Choice (A) is simple present. Choice (C) is present continuous. Choice (D) is a past participle.

question.text: The name of our company symbolizes tradition___experience.

answer.explanation: (D) “And” is used to connect two similar ideas. Choice (A) is used with “neither”. Choice (B) indicates a contrast. Choice (C) indicates a choice.

question.text: Engaging in social  _____, Ms. Mason quickly expanded her network after moving to a new city.

answer.explanation:
The blank comes after an adjective "social" => we need a noun
=> Choose B

question.text: They brought extra chairs into the room___they expected a large number of people to attend the meeting.

answer.explanation: (B) “Since” means “because”. They needed a lot of chairs because they expected a lot of people. Choices (A), (C) , and (D) are not logical in this context.

question.text: The train delays on the Trenton line were caused by a _____ error at one of the stations.

answer.explanation:
The blank precedes a noun => use adjective
=> Choose C

question.text: Same-day appointments can usually be scheduled, although not  _____  with your usual doctor.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> B

question.text: To satisfy different tastes, we strive to offer a ------- assortment of brands.

answer.explanation:
The blank is before a noun
=> Need an adjectives to modify meaning to that noun.

question.text: Thank you for your _____ in the Foxdale Apartments community enhancement survey.

answer.explanation: After the possessive adjective is a noun.

question.text: The policy that requires businesses to provide medical insurance applies only to those  _____  more than twenty-five people.

answer.explanation:
reduced relative clause using a present participle (active form) to modify "those" (indicates people)
=> Choose D

question.text: Ms. Toth slipped and fell___she was walking on the icy sidewalk in front of the building.

answer.explanation: (A) “While” means “at the same time as”. Choice (B) cannot be used to introduce a clause. Choices (C) and (D) indicate a contradiction.

question.text: In June Mr. Sudarmaji broke the record ___ the most sales generated in a single month.

answer.explanation: Record for st

question.text: The receptionists change the artwork in the clinic’s waiting room  _____  and rearrange the layout of the furniture.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose A

question.text: ______  the hospital experiences a power outage, power generators will turn on automatically to supply the necessary electricity.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> A

question.text: The energy commission has suggested that constructing roofs in a lighter, more reflective color will ___ reduce the amount of heat in urban areas.

answer.explanation: Significantly = Greatly

question.text: The food has been ordered, ___ it has not arrived.

answer.explanation: (D) Join contrasting clauses with “but”. Choices (A), (B), and (C) are not logical.

question.text: After a six-month probationary period, city employees are _____ to take vacation days.

answer.explanation: Eligible + to V

question.text: Operating instructions are posted above the printer so you can _____ refer to them.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> D
Easily add meaning to the phrase "refer to"

question.text: The education center provides training classes in key skills _____ that the unemployed can find jobs more easily.

answer.explanation:
Based on the relation of 2 clauses
=> Choose A

question.text: The museum has had to ___ the opening of the Tropo photography exhibit until further notice.

answer.explanation: Postpone an event = Put up an event = Rearrange an event to a later time.

question.text: The furniture in this apartment is not  _____   but belongs to the landlord and must be returned at the end of the lease.

answer.explanation:
The blank comes after "is" so we need to use an noun or pronoun => "ours" is correct
=> Choose A

question.text:
To: All staff members
From: Greg Birch, CTO
Subject: Server
Date: March 2
As you may know, our company server----1---- Although the disruption was only temporary and the server is now running, I am considering switching to a different system. -----2----- the server goes down again, it could create a serious problem. Because we want to prevent that from happening, I’ve spoken with Jason, the head of our IT team. He can install a new server that will be less ----3---- to malfunctions. ----4----. Thankfully, we will be able to transfer files from the old server to the new one without any difficulty.
I will continue to send you updates as I receive more information from Jason.

answer.explanation: Use the passive form of the past simple.
Use conditional sentence type I
Based on the meaning of words.

choices: (A) The breakdown is expected to be  repaired over the next few days.
(B) In addition, it will have a greater memory capacity and better security.
(C) However, this solution is impractical as it is much too costly.
(D) Several companies in the affected area reported similar outages.

answer.text: (B) In addition, it will have a greater memory capacity and better security.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence.

question.text:
Claire Staley
874 Country Lane
Stillwater, OK 74074
Dear Ms. Staley,
Best Link Telecom recently upgraded its network and is offering high-speed Internet in your area. We began delivering service ---1--- July 17.
Best Link ---2--- fast and reliable service for the lowest cost. We promise to match the price of any competitor charging less than us.
As our customer, you may use our online storage services for free. Whether you're downloading videos and photos or sharing your work, you'll be able to get it done in less time than ever ---3---.
And those already using our telephone service can get a discount of 20 percent by upgrading to a high-speed Internet package. The reduced rates will be reflected in your ---4--- for the following month.
Please call 555-1573 during regular business hours to arrange an installation appointment.
Yours truly,
George Hyde
Best Link Telecom Sales

answer.explanation: Day and month are often used with the preposition "on".

choices: (A) This service is no longer available in your area.
(B) Your bill will vary based on how many files you store.
(C) This will cause the cost of computers to be cut.

question.text:
Handy Maids Home Service

Call us at 555-1244
Handy Maids Home Service (1)_____ professional cleaning services for your business or home. We steam vacuum carpeted areas, polish hard-wood flooring, wipe away all traces of dust and dirt in hard-to-find areas, and clean out clutter. Our (2)_____ service is second to none in the tri-state area. We provide a one-day service after estimations are calculated. (3)_____, we provide weekly and monthly services for customers who request it.
The cleaning products we use are environmentally friendly and pet and child safe. (4)_____.
Please visit our website at www.handymaids.com or call US for more information.
Handy Maids Home Service (1)_____ professional cleaning services for your business or home.

answer.explanation: Use present simple to talk about facts, the subject is "Handy Maids Home Service"

question.text: Our (2)_____ service is second to none in the tri-state area. We provide a one-day service after estimations are calculated.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words

question.text: (3)_____, we provide weekly and monthly services for customers who request it.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of conjunctions

question.text: The cleaning products we use are environmentally friendly and pet and child safe. (4)_____.
choices: (A) We make sure that your pets and children don’t go near the chemicals.
(B) In fact, we aim to make the home and business a safe and clean place without the use of harsh chemicals.
(C) The all-natural cleaning agents may not be as effective, but they are safe.
(D) Pets and children will be asked to leave the premises during cleaning.

answer.text: (B) In fact, we aim to make the home and business a safe and clean place without the use of harsh chemicals.
answer.explanation: The previous sentence mentions "environmentally friendly" => B is the right answer

question.text:
DAN COOPER 10:10
Did you finish your meeting?
HEATHER BERRY 10:10
Not yet.
DAN COOPER 10:11
Okay, message me when you're done.
HEATHER BERRY 10:11
I'm free now. They took a break for snacks and the bathroom.
DAN COOPER 10:13
Great. I was wondering if you'd take the interns to lunch today.
HEATHER BERRY 10:13
Are you bailing on it?
DAN COOPER 10:14
I have to. I need to be in North Point by 2.
HEATHER BERRY 10:14
No worries. I'll take them.
DAN COOPER 10:16
Thanks. I'd hate to cancel on them.
What is suggested about Ms. Berry?
choices: (C) She is in the middle of meetings.
(D) She plans on cancelling a lunch appointment.

answer.text: (C) She is in the middle of meetings.
answer.explanation: You can infer from the following sentence in the message: “I am free now. They had a snack."

question.text: At 10:13, what does Ms. Berry mean when she writes, “Are you bailing on it?”
choices: (A) She’s asking if Mr. Cooper has finished his meeting.
(B) She’s inquiring if Mr. Cooper will be missing the appointment.
(C) She wants to know if Mr. Cooper will go to North Point.
(D) She would like Mr. Cooper to notify her when he leaves.

answer.text: (B) She’s inquiring if Mr. Cooper will be missing the appointment.
answer.explanation: Based on Cooper's answer, it is possible to infer the meaning of this quest

question.text:
11:01 James: Where are you?
11:25 Robert: What do you mean? I've been here all morning.
11:26 James: ? I haven't seen you anywhere.
12:00 James: Where r u?
12:03 Robert: Sorry, I've been with a client in the Red Lounge, couldn't get your message.
12:04 James: K got it, I'll be outside the lounge waiting.
12:30 Robert: You still there?
12:31 James: Yeah, hope you closed the deal!
Why does James most likely say, “hope you closed the deal!”?
choices: (A) He thinks there will be a bonus.
(B) He has been waiting for a long time.
(D) There are too many deals open.

answer.text: (B) He has been waiting for a long time.
answer.explanation: There are lots of deals open up. James has been looking for Robert all morning and waiting outside the Red Lounge. So it can be inferred that he is very eager to meet, so the phrase "hope you have closed the deal" means looking forward to meeting.

question.text: What can be inferred about Robert by the length of time between James’ messages and Robert’s responses?
choices: (D) He cannot check his phone all the time.

answer.text: (D) He cannot check his phone all the time.
answer.explanation: The information is in Robert's message line: "Sorry, I was with the same customer at the Red Lounge, didn't receive your messages"

question.text:
MEMO

From: Harumi Ohta, Kitchen Manager
To: All Staff

It is essential that all food handlers practice good personal hygiene throughout the year, but it is especially important during the upcoming cold and flu season. Viruses can be carried on hands, linger on work surfaces such as countertops and cutting boards, and find their way onto utensils and plates. Therefore, all employees who work with food must wash their hands before handling any food or utensils used in the preparation or delivery of food.
Instructions on the proper method for washing your hands are posted at the entrance to the kitchen, in the restrooms, and in the meeting room next to the lobby. Please follow them diligently.

Harumi.
What is the memo about?

answer.explanation: It is easy to see the contents of internal announcements about washing hands before handling food or kitchen utensils. So this is a safety routine.

question.text: What items are most likely mentioned in the posted instructions?

answer.explanation: According to the announcement, instructions are posted on the “proper method for washing your hands”. So the items most involved in this can only be soap and water.

question.text:
Helping Hands

8732 Bakersfield Avenue, Santa Clara, California

www.helpinghands.com


Regional Manager—Employment Opportunity


Helping Hands has been dedicated to providing quality, affordable housing for low-income individuals and families. For over 25 years, we have been acquiring multifamily communities and improving the properties to maintain their availability for those earning less than 50 percent of the area's average income. Our properties are currently located in cities throughout the state of Texas—including Austin, Dallas, and Houston—with plans to expand to make more homes available to more people.
We are looking for someone for the position of regional manager. The new manager will be stationed in Austin and will supervise and evaluate the performance of on-site management and ensure that the properties are well- maintained. The candidate must have a bachelor’s degree or higher in a business or management field, have a minimum of three years of experience in supervising other personnel, and possess certain certificates (more details in the application page).
Applications can be submitted in person Monday through Friday from 9:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. or through mail or e-mail. They will be accepted only if they are received before 5:00 P.M. on October 14.
Where is the successful candidate required to work?

answer.explanation: Information on 2nd Sentence 2nd paragraph “The new manager will be stationed in Austin

question.text: What is mentioned about Helping Hands?
choices: (A) It offers community service for senior citizens.
(B) It is committed to nature conservation.
(C) It is sponsored by the government.
(D) It is supplying homes to a disadvantaged group.

answer.text: (D) It is supplying homes to a disadvantaged group.
answer.explanation: The information can be found at the first sentence “Helping Hands has been dedicated to providing quality, affordable housing for low-income individuals and families.”

question.text: What is NOT suggested about the position?
choices: (A) It includes supervision of the local staff.
(D) It is limited to only California residents.

answer.text: (D) It is limited to only California residents.
answer.explanation:
Using the exclusion method, it can be seen that only information in option D is not covered.
Option A: “The new manager will be stationed in Austin and will supervise and evaluate the performance of on-site management” (The new manager will be sent to Austin and will supervise and evaluate the management implementation. local management)
Option B: “The candidate must have a bachelor's degree or higher in a business or management field” (Candidates must have a bachelor's degree or higher in business or management) < br> Option C: “possess certain certificates (more details in the application page)”. (possess certain other certificates (details on application page).

question.text:
Attention Shoppers


We regret to inform you that there has been a general recall on all Kent brand ladders manufactured between March 30 and July 30 this year.

• The ladders do not comply with mandatory safety standards and could be unstable.
• The ladders could move while standing on them and could contribute to dangerous falls.
• Do not use the ladders for any reason. Contact the Kent Company to receive a refund or a replacement product. Customers will receive a full refund even without proof of purchase as long as they return the ladders.

The Kent Company can be reached by calling 1-800-555-2493. Press 8 in order to be transferred to a representative who deals exclusively with product recalls. We sincerely apologize for this inconvenience.
Where most likely could this notice be found?

answer.explanation:
Skim reading the whole article => remind, pay attention to using ladders

=> answer B is the most suitable

question.text: What are customers warned about?

answer.explanation:
- Consider the meaning of the bold paragraph containing information about the use of the ladder:

• The ladders do not comply with mandatory safety standards and could be unstable. 

• The ladders could move while standing on them and could contribute to dangerous falls.                     

• Do not use the ladders for any reason. Contact the Kent Company to receive a refund or a replacement product. Customers will receive a full refund even without proof of purchase as long as they return the ladders.          

=> 3 answers B, C & D are not mentioned in the article => choose A

question.text: According to the notice, how can more information be obtained?

answer.explanation:
- The second sentence, the third paragraph:  

"Contact the Kent Company to receive a refund or a replacement product."

- First sentence last paragraph: 

"The Company can be reached by Kent calling 1-800-555 2493."

question.text:
Attention Members of Super Fit Gym


One workout plan doesn't work for everyone. That is why here at Super Fit Gym we offer the largest variety of fitness programs in the area. You are sure to find something fun and exciting that helps you meet your fitness goals. Now we are excited to bring you a new dance fitness program.The class will run this summer from June 12 to August 23. Dance is an interesting and interactive way to exercise. It is also appropriate for those individuals who are not able to engage in strenuous physical activity.

Those who wish to sign up for this dance class are encouraged to sign up in pairs. If you don't have someone to sign up with, you will team up with another individual on the first day of a class. Registration will be available from May 10 to June 1. You can register on our website by filling out a registration form. A class fee must be paid at the time of registration by credit card.

In accordance with our rules and regulations, those who wish to receive a class fee refund must withdraw from a class a week or more before the scheduled start date. No refund will be given to those who withdraw from a class after that deadline.

For more details concerning class content, schedules, and fees, contact our manager, Scott Peterson, at (231) 555-2523.

Sincerely,
Super Fit Gym Staff
What is the purpose of the notice?

answer.explanation:
- The fourth sentence, paragraph 1:

"Now we are excited to bring you a new dance fitness program."

question.text: What most likely will happen on June 12?
choices: (B) Some members will be assigned partners.
(D) Some certificates of completion will be issued.

answer.text: (B) Some members will be assigned partners.
answer.explanation:
- Sentence 5, paragraph 1: The class will run this summer from June 12 to August 23.
- The second sentence, paragraph 2: "If you don't have someone to sign up with, you will team up with another individual on the first day."

question.text: According to the notice, what is the latest date that participants can receive a refund for the class?

answer.explanation:
- Paragraph 3: In compliance with our rules and regulations, those who wish to receive a class fee refund must withdraw from a class a week or more before the scheduled start date. No refund will be given to those who withdraw from a class after that deadline.

- According to information provided in question 169, the class starts from June 12 => at least 1 week before the start date ie at least 1 week before June 12

=> only answer B is the most suitable

question.text: What is mentioned as a reason to contact Mr. Peterson?

answer.explanation:
- The last paragraph:

"Concerning class content for more details, schedules, and fees, contact our manager, Scott Peterson, at (231) 555 2523. "

question.text: 16 July, Newtown—Health Shack is downtown Newtown's hottest new hangout for fitness buffs and corporate employees alike. - [1] - Owners Jill and Barry Baker opened the shop last month to rave reviews and long lines. Getting a seat or table at Health Shack can take as long as 30 minutes on a good day and the place is always crowded no matter the time of day. Health Shack offers only six items on its menu; all are protein shakes including the best sellers, Apple Pie, Peanut Butter Cup, and Tuity Fruity. - [2] - "We were overwhelmed by the response," says Jill Baker. "In fact, everything spread by word of mouth so we didn't even need to advertise." Fitness Instructor Julian Miles said, "I love coming here for a quick lunch that won't wreck my fitness goals. I even recommend this place to all my patrons."- [3] - "I come here to get a healthy but satisfying meal during my short break with my co-workers," added businessman Tim Hammer. "Without Health Shack, we'd be eating junk food." - [4] - Health Shack is open from 7:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. from Mondays through Fridays, and from 9:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. on Saturdays. It closes on Sundays. The owners hope to add new flavors to the menu in the coming months.
What is suggested about the shop?
choices: (C) It has been open for a longtime.
(D) Only fitness experts patron the shop.

answer.explanation: It can be inferred from " Getting a seat or table at Health Shack can take as long as 30 minutes on a good day and the place is always crowded no matter the time of day." that the shop is always crowded and it takes long time to get a seat.

question.text: What is suggested  about Health Shack products?

answer.explanation: Based on the review of the customers about the products which are healthy but satifying meal and will not wreck the fitness goal.

question.text: Why don’t the owners advertise?
choices: (C) Their customers recommend the place to others

answer.text: (C) Their customers recommend the place to others
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: ""We were overwhelmed by the response," says Jill Baker."

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence belong?
“Despite the limited number of products on the menu, customers can’t get enough of the tasty but healthy shakes that are on offer.”

answer.explanation: Based on the information in "Health Shack offers only six items on its menu; all are protein shakes including the best sellers, Apple Pie, Peanut Butter Cup, and Tuity Fruity.", it can be inferred that the number of the item on menu is limited.

question.text:
Employee Winner of National Contest


One of our employees here at Arrow Design Laboratory, Jennifer Holt, has won first place in a web design contest hosted by the Association of Web Designers. Entrants were judged according to clarity of idea, quality of execution, and aesthetics. Ms. Holt was selected among over 300 different applicants. We applaud her achievement and are so happy to have her as an employee at Arrow Design Laboratory.

The Association of Web Designers (AWD) is an organization founded in 2002 with the goal ọf emphasizing the importance of web design and protecting the rights of web designers. The AWD has members all over the world and is constantly gaining new members. The AWD hosts a variety of contests in order to promote web design as a professional field. The AWD believes that good design can enhance people's lives and build better communities.

As a recipient of the first place for the web design contest, Ms. Holt will receive a cash prize as well as free membership in the Association of Web Designers. In addition, she has been invited to give a speech at the Annual Web Designers' Conference to be held next month in Los Angeles, California. The AWD will be holding more contests in the future, and those interested should visit the website at www.awd.com/contests to find out more information.
Why most likely was the article written?
choices: (B) To report on an award winner
(D) To describe a change in company policy

answer.text: (B) To report on an award winner
answer.explanation:
Read the title and first sentence of the article:

Employee Winner of National Contest

One of our employees here at Arrow Design Laboratory, Jennifer Holt, has won first place in a web design contest

question.text: What is suggested about the Association of Web Designers?
choices: (A) It holds a conference every year.
(B) It is based in Los Angeles.

answer.text: (A) It holds a conference every year.
answer.explanation: Read the second sentence of the last paragraph: In addition, she has been invited to give a speech at the Annual Web Designers' Conference to be held next month in Los Angeles, California.

question.text: The word “founded” in paragraph 2, line 1, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: Based on meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text: According to the article, what can be found on the website?
choices: (B) An application for an open position
(D) A list of Ms. Holt’s accomplishments

answer.explanation:
Read the last sentence:

The AWD will be holding more contests in the future, and those interested should visit the website at  www.awd.com/contests to find out more information

question.text:
Questions refer to the following e-mails and order form

To:Raquel Jenkins- cservice@starproducts.com
From:Jose Ramos - jramos.zipnet.com
Date:October 14
Subject:Defective Hose

Dear Ms. Jenkins,
Recently, I purchased 5,000 yards of XP100 industrial hosing from your company, star Products. The hosing was listed as capable of handling up to 1,000 pounds of pressure per square inch (psi). My company, Advanced Dynamic Cleaning, refitted all of our pressure washers with your hosing at considerable cost and time. Every single one of our pressure washers failed somewhere along the hosing from the joint of the gun to the compressor. Our compressors only create 500 psi, so I have to conclude that there is some defect in the design of your hose. I would like to get a refund of my purchase or a replacement of my order with hosing that meets industry standards. I have included my purchase order and a copy of the invoice.

Sincerely,
Jose Ramos
===========================

To:Jose Ramos - jramos.zipnet.com
From: Raquel Jenkins- cservice@starproducts.com
Date:October 16
Subject:Defective Hose

Dear Mr. Ramos,

We have received your report of a defective hose and reviewed the attached documents. We really value your business and hate that you went through such a waste of time and energy with our hosing. However, I am afraid to say that the mistake may be on your end. In looking over your purchase, you clearly ordered XP100 hosing X 5,000 yards. If you look at the specs for that hosing, it is only rated at appropriate for 100 psi. This could explain why all of your hosing failed. What I can offer you is an exchange of the remaining XP100 hosing in your inventory for a hosing more appropriate to your needs. We will do this at no charge and pay for the shipping as a show of our appreciation for your business. Please fill out the purchase order that I have attached and include it with the XP100 hosing when you ship it back to US for exchange.

Thank you,
Raquel Jenkins
===========================
@PS@/onthisinhvien.appspot.com/images/6789034_1592552433067.png@PE@
===========================
Why did Jose Ramos write to star Products?
choices: (C) To report a malfunction of hosing

answer.text: (C) To report a malfunction of hosing
answer.explanation: The content of the first email is to complain about the pressure hose and damage.

question.text: What is indicated about the hosing that Jose Ramos ordered?
choices: (A) It was not rated for the right PSI for his use.
(D) They were delivered to the wrong address.

answer.text: (A) It was not rated for the right PSI for his use.
answer.explanation: From the second email, namely, “In looking over your purchase, you clearly ordered XP 100 hosing x 5,000 yards. If you look at the specs for that hosing, it is only rated at appropriate for 100 psi. It is conceivable that the tube that Jose Ramos purchased is not suitable for the pressure to use.

question.text: According to the purchase order form, how much XP100 hosing is Jose Ramos returning?

answer.explanation: Order, Mr. Jose Ramos will get 2500 yards XP 1000. In the second email he said that he would return the remaining XP 100 tubes. So we can infer that the number of returns is equal to 2500.

question.text: What is indicated in the e-mail from star Products?
choices: (A) Star Products does not value Jose Ramos’ business.
(B) Star Products appreciates Jose Ramos’ patronage.
(C) Star Products doesn’t need any more business.
(D) Star Products wants to expand their business.

answer.text: (B) Star Products appreciates Jose Ramos’ patronage.
answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: “We really value your business” (We take business very seriously)

question.text: What job does Raquel Jenkins likely have?

answer.explanation: From the second email, it can be inferred that Raquel Jenkins does the job. receive customer feedback and send replies. As such, this is most likely the job of the customer service employee.

question.text:
To:Lillian Ross -lillianross@kingstonsportinggoods.com
From:Eric West -ericwest@jmsolutions.com
Date:November 4, 10:34 A.M.
Subject:Website Development
Attachment: Details

Dear Ms. Ross,
You contacted US last week in order to ask some of our computer programmers to help your company develop a website. JM Solutions would be happy to offer you our services.
As I said on the phone, we will help design and program a website that will attract more customers and offer an online sales platform. During this time, we will need to hold meetings with your marketing division in order to best capture your company’s goals. Once the website has been completed in mid-February next year, we will hold a training seminar in order to train your employees in the skills necessary to maintain and update your website. The website development and training seminar will cost a total of $32,000. We request that a deposit of 10% be paid in advance. Please see the attached file for detailed costs and schedules.
We look forward to working with you in the near future. Our staff members will strive to meet all your needs.. Therefore, just let me know when your marketing division is available to meet US in person and discuss some of the details of the project. Please contact me at your convenience.
Eric West

===========================

To:Lillian Ross -lillianross@kingstonsportinggoods.com
From:Raymond Wells -raymondwells@kingstonsportinggoods.com
Date:November 4, 10:37 A.M.
Subject:First Quarter Budget
Attachment: Q1_Budget

Dear Ms. Ross,
I have attached the current draft for the company’s budget for the first quarter of next year. As you will notice, all of the profits made from this year’s back-to-school sale are planned to be spent on billboard advertisements on the main highways. I will call a design team later this afternoon and ask them to create eye-catching images for the advertisement.
At our last meeting, you mentioned that you would like to review the budget before it is finalized. I have already included employee raises in the first quarter’s expenses, but if you can think of anything else, please let me know. I would like to have the budget finalized before next week’s planning meeting.
Raymond Wells

===========================

To:Raymond Wells -raymondwells@kingstonsportinggoods.com
From:Lillian Ross -lillianross@kingstonsportinggoods.com
Date:November 4, 10:40 AM
Subject:Emergency Budget Addition

Dear Mr. Wells,
I am glad you forwarded me your proposed budget when you did. Just prior to receiving your e-mail, I received an estimate for our planned website development. It looks like it is going to be more expensive than I had anticipated. Although the final bill of $32,000 is not due immediately, we will have to find an extra $3,200 in next year’s first quarter budget if we want to proceed with JM Solutions’ proposal.
If you have any questions regarding this matter, please just come to my office and we can go over where we can make the tough cuts to come up with this funding.
Why did Mr. West write the first e-mail?

answer.explanation:
The first part of the email: “JM Solutions would be happy to offer you our services .” 

The end of the email: “Therefore, just let me know when your marketing division is available to meet us in person and discuss some of the details of the project”

question.text: What service does JM Solutions provide?

answer.explanation: The first part of the email: ”.... we will help design and program a website ....”

question.text: According to the second e-mail, how will the profits of the back-to-school sale be spent?
choices: (C) On paying for JM Solutions’ service

answer.explanation:
Keyword "profit", "back-to- school sale"

The sentence contains keywords: “As you will notice, all of the profits made from this year's back-to-school sale are planned to be spent on billboard advertisement on the main highways.”

question.text: What is indicated by the third e-mail?
choices: (A) The budget for the first quarter of next year looks good.
(B) JM Solutions has a strong reputation.
(C) It will be easy for Kingston Sporting Goods to find money in their budget for web development.
(D) Some items in the budget may lose their funding in order to pay for web development.

answer.text: (D) Some items in the budget may lose their funding in order to pay for web development.
answer.explanation:
The inferred question, based on information “I received an estimate for our planned website development             

Although the final bill of $ 32,000 is not due immediately, we will have to find an extra $ 3,800 in next year's first quarter if we want to proceed with JM Solutions' proposal. ”

question.text: Why does Kingston Sporting Goods need to allow for $3,200 for web development?
choices: (A) They need the best web money can buy.
(B) They have to expand their business into other territories.
(C) They have to pay JM Solutions 10% of the overall cost as a deposit.
(D) They have to negotiate a better price after the deposit.

answer.text: (C) They have to pay JM Solutions 10% of the overall cost as a deposit.
answer.explanation: In the first email when JM Solutions introduced their service: “The website development and training seminar will cost a total of $ 32,000. We request that a deposit of 10% be paid in advance.

question.text:
http://www.positivohealth.com

Positivo Health Community

Welcome Membership Services Locations                  
Positivo Heath Community offers four types of gym memberships. All memberships include access to exercise machines, basketball and tennis court, and group exercise classes in all five of our Devenport locations. Additionally, each new member receives one free personal-training session.
Single ($35/month)
This membership includes basic access to our gym locations as described above.
Household ($30/month per person)
This membership includes basic access to our gym locations at a discounted rate for families of two or more individuals who join together.
Executive ($60/month)
In addition to basic access to our gym locations, executive membership includes access to our swimming pools and saunas.
Student ($25/month)
This membership offers basic access to our gym locations to local Provost University students who present valid student identification.



=============================

February 28
Dear Ron Mapleton,
Thank you for making Positivo Health Community a part of your total-body health program. It was so nice to meet you and your family when I showed you around our Davenport Central location in December.
We noticed that you have not yet taken advantage of your free hour of personal training. Each person on your account is entitled to one free session, but this perk expires three months after your contract is signed. Next week, the week of March 4, is the last week you will be able to use your free sessions. Please contact us today to schedule your personal-training sessions!
As a reminder, we offer one-on-one training for power yoga, Pilates, weight training, and power lifting. If you should choose to make personal training a regular part of your fitness routine, packages start at only $70 per month in addition to your monthly membership due.
Your partner in health,
Janie Park
Janie Park, Membership Manager

==========================
Personal-Training Schedule for Next Week
March 4-8
Employee: Kevin Pinto
Location: Devenport Central
  Monday Tuesday Wednesday Thursday Friday
8:00 A.M.   Stacey Lin
Power Yoga		 Ron Mapleton
Power Yoga		   Kim Dobbs
Weight Training
9:00 A.M. PilarHernandez
Weight Training		        
10:00 A.M       Jean-Luc Curran
Power Lifting		  
11:00 A.M.   Jaylon Hill
Power Yoga
What is indicated about Psitivo Health Community?
choices: (B) Its members can use multiple facilities.
(C) Most of its members are students.

answer.text: (B) Its members can use multiple facilities.
answer.explanation: “exercise machines, basketball and tennis court, and group exercise classes”

question.text: What type of membership does Mr. Mapleton most likely have?

answer.explanation: “Each person on your account is entitled to one free session”

question.text: What is indicated about Ms. Park?
choices: (B) She started her job in December.
(C) She creates weekly schedules for gym employees.
(D) She gave Mr. Mapleton a tour of the gym

answer.text: (D) She gave Mr. Mapleton a tour of the gym
answer.explanation: “It was so nice to meet you and your family when I showed you around our Davenport Central location in December”

question.text: In the letter, the word "packages" in paragraph 3, line 3, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: "Package" here is understood as a service package, each package has its own exercise plan and benefits. In the given answers, there is a "plan" that means "plan, project", most suitable to replace "package" in this context.

question.text: What is probably true about Mr. Pinto?
choices: (A) He does not work on Fridays.
(C) He has not trained Mr. Mapleton before.
(D) He has requested a change to his schedule.

answer.text: (C) He has not trained Mr. Mapleton before.
answer.explanation: From the timeline of March 4-8, it can be seen that Mr. Mapleton went to the Power yoga class for the first session on March 6, but according to the email, Mr. Mapleton has not used his personal training session, and the week from March 4 is the last week prior to expiration. Thus, Mr. Mapleton's personal training session in this calendar can be inferred as his first, meaning that Mr. Pinto has never practiced for Mapleton before.

question.text:
From:customerservice@thomsonapp.com
To:dkerry@coolmail.com
Date:July 6
Subject: Malfunction

Dear Ms. Kerry,
We are very sorry to hear about the malfunction with your deluxe refrigerator, MK1213, purchased from Thomson Appliances. You indicated that the ice dispenser on the door of the fridge has stopped functioning. Actually, several customers have reported the same problem. It turned out that the manufacturers made an error in the production process. Fortunately, this problem can easily be fixed by one of our technicians. Currently, our technicians are available Monday, Wednesday, and Thursday next week. Please specify what day and what time works for you.
Additionally, if your refrigerator is under warranty, this repair will be absolutely free. Please let us know your warranty number so we can verify this before sending a technician to your house.
We apologize for this inconvenience. Thank you again for choosing Thomson Appliances.
Sincerely,
Greg Lewis Customer Service

===========================

From:dkerry@coolmail.com
To:customerservice@thomsonapp.com
Date:July 7
Subject: Re: Malfunction

Dear Mr. Lewis,

Thank you for your prompt response. Actually, next week I will be away on a business trip in Arkansas and I won’t return until Saturday. However, I have a housekeeper who comes to clean on Monday and Friday. If your technician visits on either day, she can let him or her in.
My warranty number is A344F56J and is still valid. I will leave this document with my housekeeper in case you need to see it during your visit.
Dana Kerry

===========================

From:customerservice@thomsonapp.com
To:dkerry@coolmail.com
Date:July 7
Subject: Repair Time

Dear Ms. Kerry,

Our technician will be able to come by your house on Monday. You will need to be sure to leave the warranty documents so the technician can scan them into our system. This is necessary for us to be reimbursed by the manufacturers. Our technician will come by in the morning and try to be gone by lunch; even though you have a housekeeper, they will try not to leave a mess. Safe travels and we appreciate your patience. Thank you for your loyalty to Thompson Appliances.
Sincerely,
Greg Lewis
Customer Service
What is one reason the first e-mail was sent?
choices: (B) To ask for a date for a visit
(D) To apologize for a shipping delay

answer.text: (B) To ask for a date for a visit
answer.explanation: Note that the subject of the email is malfunction (N) malfunction Information at the end of header: “Please specify what day and what time works for you”

question.text: According to the first e-mail, what is true about the refrigerator?
choices: (A) It is a newly released model.
(B) It is no longer covered by the warranty.

answer.explanation: The first paragraph of the email says: "You say the ice dispenser on the door of the c has stopped functioning"

question.text: What information does Mr. Lewis request from Ms. Kerry?

answer.explanation: At the end of paragraph 2 of Mr. Lewis's email: “Please let us know your warranty number so we can verify this before sending a technician to your house”

question.text: Why does the technician need to scan the warranty?
choices: (A) To make sure It is still covered
(B) To make sure that the model is correct
(C) To make sure that there are enough spare parts to make the repairs
(D) To make sure that the manufacturer covers the repair costs

answer.text: (D) To make sure that the manufacturer covers the repair costs
answer.explanation: In email test 3 comes Ms. Kerry: ”You will need to be sure to leave the warranty documents so the technician can scan them into your system. This is necessary for us to be reimbursed by the manufacturers. ”

question.text: Why do you think the technician will come on Monday?
choices: (A) Because that is the time the technician is available
(B) Because the technician is too busy on Friday
(C) Because the housekeeper will be there to let him in
(D) Because Ms. Kerry is in Arkansas

answer.text: (C) Because the housekeeper will be there to let him in
answer.explanation:
- In the second email sent by Ms. Kerry: “... I have a housekeeper who comes to clean on Monday and Friday. If your technician visits on either day, she can let him or her in. "

- In the 3rd email sent by Mr. Lewis: “Our technician will be able to come by your house on Monday”

question.text:
Blooming Flower Yoga Studio

Summer Yoga Classes:
This summer we will be offering a variety of summer yoga classes for all age groups and skill levels.

Summer Class Schedule and Prices (registration fee):
Beginner class, twice a week for two months ($150)
Intermediate and advanced class, twice a week for two months ($200)
Yoga for senior citizens, once a week for two months ($100)
Hot power yoga, three times a week for two months ($250)

All necessary supplies will be provided by the Blooming FlowerYoga Studio. Members should wear comfortable clothes that allow for free movement.

45 Clark Street
Indianapolis, IN 46202
715-555-5832
www.bloomingfloweryoga.com

===========================

To: Tammy Glenn - tammyglenn@mxmail.com
From: Dwayne Moore - dwaynemoore@bloomingfloweryoga.com
Date: May 23
Subject: New Student
Attachment: New member form

Dear Ms. Glenn,
I’m writing to let you know that you have one more student who has signed up for your class. Your new student is Jane Meyers and she will bring the $100 registration fee with her to the first class on Monday.
Also, on Monday, please give Ms. Meyers and any other new members the form they will need to fill out. I have attached the necessary paperwork to this e-mail. All you have to do is to print out copies and hand them out.
Your class now has nine members that will attend and is, therefore, almost at full capacity. In fact, all of the classes this summer have proved very popular, and I anticipate they will all fill up by the end of the month. Thank you so much for your many years of hard work as a teacher here at Blooming Flower Yoga studio. If you have any questions, let me know.

Dwayne Moore
What is stated about the summer classes?
choices: (C) They are available to both children and adults.
(D) They are being offered at a discounted price.

answer.text: (C) They are available to both children and adults.
answer.explanation: Information is at the phrase "This summer we will be offering a variety of summer yoga classes for all age groups and skill levels."

question.text: What is indicated about Ms. Glenn?
choices: (D) She will be receiving a pay raise.

answer.explanation: The information is in the sentence “Thank you so much for your many years of hard work as a teacher here at Blooming Flower Yoga Studio ”

question.text: What is Ms. Glenn asked to do?

answer.explanation: Information contained in sentence “'I have attached the necessary paperwork to this e-mail. All you have to do is to print out copies and hand them out.

question.text: What is suggested about Ms. Meyers?
choices: (A) She has never learned yoga before.
(C) She wants to become a yoga instructor.

answer.explanation: In the email, it says that Ms. Meyers will bring in $ 100 in the beginning. Again in the advertisement, the only class that costs $ 100 is the senior class

question.text: In the e-mail, the word “capacity” in paragraph 3, line 1, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: "capacity" is the closest means with "volume".
